meanings.sent1: He redrills the hole to make it deeper.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker redrills the same spot for accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The teacher redrills the math concept until everyone understands.
meanings.sent4: Her determination redrills through any obstacles in her way.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the drill redrills in his ears long after work.

meanings.definition: Redrills (noun): drills that are repeated or done again
meanings.sent1: The redrills in the training session were exhausting.
meanings.sent2: The coach organized redrills to improve the team's skills.
meanings.sent3: The redrills in the practice felt like a never-ending cycle.
meanings.sent4: The redrills of the alarm woke him up every morning.
meanings.sent5: The redrills of the dance routine made it perfect for the performance.
